lines.text: Are you going to kiss me now?
No.
Well then let's get the hell out of here.
Why is Crate 16 so important?
Only one other person knew the answer to that, and that's why she had to die.

[after discovering Svevo and his men gathering plutonium]
You can take whatever you want from this ship, but these people have come a long way and all they want to do right now is get the hell out of here alive!
I never intended to harm anyone Captain, as you must realize, I can't let you go now.

[to Captain Turner]
As you must realize... I can't let you go now!

[having to jump over a hole that's 6 feet long]
You know... I have the shortest legs of anybody here.
Do it!
Okay!

[as the crews are inspecting the upside-down stern]
I hope you are a religilous man, Captain. I've taken the liberty of saying a small prayer for us.
All of us?
Well, it is my feeling that... from this time on, our faiths are necessarily intertwined.
Good. Then you won't be offended if I remind you of that from time to time.
In times of real trouble, the one thing man can depend on is the sympathy of the bank.
Take a look up there. Copper right?
[the Rescue helicopter carrying the 6 survivors flies overhead]
French Coastguard.
[looks at the helicopter through his binoculars]
For them to out this far, some ship must be in big trouble.
That prayer you did up there... what religion would that be?
Greek Orthodox.
No kidding? I'm Greek Orthodox... suddenly!
Happy New Year, I may have found a way out.

[after boarding the Poseidon]
That fire must've been started by the last explosion. More could come anytime.
I'm telling ya it's a floating time bomb!

[during the first inspection of the upside-down hull]
This hole must've been cut by the rescue team from the chopper.

[looking in]
It seems quiet enough now.
[Mike climbs through the hole]
You know if we can work our way down to the purser's office, blow the safe and then work our way back out, let's see... out the side...
I told you... you don't have to come along old man.
I know I don't *have* to.
I could use you.
Yeah I know that too.
Thank you.
You don't have to thank an old man.
Please can we just get out of here as quickly as possible?
It took two years to put this thing together. You really believe I can get off, *without* it?
I've done everything you wanted. Now I just want to get out!
I understand, but I've got the bullet, if I could've avoided it. But since I'm here, since we're *both* here, we've got to see this thing through!

[after jumping over a hole that's 6 feet long]
Coming Doctor?

[on the other side of the hole with his men]
Well I've been thinking Captain, we're separated at two cabins. We'll go left, and you and your folly continue forward.
Is that an order?
Hopefully it's a constructive suggestion.
All right Doctor. We'll play it your way.
Theresa, your father... has he always had a one-track mind?
Well... you know his bark is worse than his bite. He means well.
Yeah well... I guess if I had a daughter as pretty as you are, I'd probably act the same way.
[Theresa looks at Larry lovingly and smiles]
Oh thank you.

[about the exit the Poseidon through an underwater side door]
None of us are experienced divers Captain.
It's our only way out. I'm going to turn you all into frogmen. No one has a choice.
[puts down 2 scuba tanks]
There should be 2 more Wilbur. I counted 4.
One's empty. The one I'm getting is half full.
Who's going in the scuba?
Everyone.
Last time I went to school, 3 didn't go into 8.
What you say?
3 doesn't go into 8.
With him, it's possible.
[meaning Mike]
You mean Jack Custo never taught buddy breathing?
What's buddy...?
That's more than one diver on a single tank. Wilbur and I have done it before so we'll use the least air.

[as his boat moves alongside Mike's boat]
I'm Doctor Stefan Svevo and this the Medical Rescue Ship Irene. That must be the Poseidon. We heard her S.O.S. last night.
Clear off. I have the salvage rights here. Captain Michael Turner.
A capsized ship is like a giant air bubble Captain and there may be survivors. My paramedics and I could be instrumental and try and get them off, give medical attention if needed.
I think the survivors have been taken out, but you can look and take out any you find. But only survivors. I will take out anything else that I find. Is that understood.?
Well that was my original proposition to you Captain.
Good. Then we will start getting our gear together, and I suggest you do the same.
We're prepared to go aboard right now but don't worry Captain, we'll wait.
[an explosion causes the safe in the Purser's office to fall through the floor and open]

[looking at the gold coins and cash]
Well what do you know?
Well that's one way to crack a safe.
[Celeste starts climb down into the room below]
Where do you think you're going?
Let's not wait around for the cash arrive.
[Mike and Wilbur climd down into the room below with Celeste and look at the contents of the safe]

[picks up a gold coin]
1796.
How much do you think they're worth?
100 times its weight in gold.
Bort?
What?
Bort.
What's that?
Industrial diamonds.
How much are they worth?
Oh I think, 3 or $400,000 worth.
[Mike looks amazed]
Now wait a minute, tell me the truth, is this really ours?
Yeah it's Salvage. Pack up and let's get out of here.

[excited]
Can see it now Mike? Along the Riviera? We're rich! You know what? We don't need a bank anymore do we?
[laughs]
[the tugboat Jenny is sailing into the Sunset with the survivors]

[joins Mike on the bridge]
Poor Wilbur. Why did he do it?
We only had 2 air tanks. He knew we never had a chance so, gave whatever life he had left.
I really loved that old man.
What are you going to do now? Go back to your chateau?
There is no chateau.
Some place must be home.
I'm open to suggestions.
Well I... I'll sign you on the journey, but the bank's going to take boat away as soon as we reach port.
Maybe not.
[Celeste takes out an industrial diamond which she salvaged from the Poseidon]
Gonna to kiss me now?
I was gonna kiss you anyway.
[they kiss and the tugboat Jenny sails into the Sunset]

[looking at the cargo of plutonium]
There's enough here to start a war!

[appearing with his men behind a stack of crates]
Well that's a slight exaggeration. I'm sorry about this Captain. I had hoped that we would never meet again.
Who is that? What's he want?
It's your basic guard variety terroist. I think he wants to kill us.
to recover a piece of property which was *already* mine.
You can take *whatever* you want from this ship. I'm welcome to it, but these people have come a long way, and all they want right now is get the hell out of here alive!
As one man says this to another...
[Svevo's men point their guns at Tex]
Now hold on just hear me out son.
[They lower their rifles slightly]
Tell you what, I'll, I'll write a check for the whole shabbang here. If you just lay down your little rifles, we'll all haul ass out of here together. What do you say?
Take a look at that open crate behind me Captain. I sincerly doubt that your friend over there reimburse me for *that*.
OK. Open it. Let's see.
You open that barrel Captain and we all die. And I have every reasonable hope of wanting to watch the sunset tonight.

[annoyed]
This crap you're dishing out here, you trying to tell us you've got some kind of doomsday machine in there or something?
With the information commonly available today, any enterprising... science student could build a nuclear device.
Uranium?

[proudly]
Plutonium. And as the American Govenment is painfully aware, this isn't the first shipment to go astray.
Ah, son? Now listen to me. If I was to tell you that I've got certain connections at the Peenee Gon...
Then I would have to tell you that my connection are more powerful than yours. I never intended to harm anyone Captain. But as you must realize... I can't let you go now.
[another explosion occurs]
